skill.name: typescript-advanced-types
skill.description: Master TypeScript's advanced type system including generics, conditional types, mapped types, template literals, and utility types for building type-safe applications. Use when implementing complex type logic, creating reusable type utilities, or ensuring compile-time type safety in TypeScript projects.
skill.summary: Master TypeScript's advanced type system including generics, conditional types, mapped types, templa...

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or network activity was found. The content is instructional TypeScript examples without execution or persistence behavior.

content.value_statement: Complex type logic can be hard to design and maintain. This skill provides patterns and examples to build reusable and safe TypeScript types.
actual_capabilities: Explain generics with constraints and multiple type parameters
Show conditional and distributive conditional type patterns
Demonstrate mapped types with key remapping and filtering
Provide template literal type techniques for string patterns
Outline advanced patterns like typed event emitters and API clients
limitations: Does not run or type-check code in your project
Does not infer types from your codebase automatically
Does not replace TypeScript compiler diagnostics
Does not cover runtime validation libraries

use_cases.description: Build ergonomic generic APIs and utility types for public packages.

use_cases.title: Type-safe UI models

use_cases.title: Typed API clients
use_cases.description: Create strongly typed request and response contracts.

prompt_templates.title: Learn a concept

prompt_templates.title: Build a utility type
prompt_templates.scenario: I want a reusable helper type
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a mapped type that picks properties by value type and explain how it works.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced inference
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to infer parameter and return types from a generic function and apply them in an API client.

output_examples.input: Show a type-safe builder pattern for a User object
output: Tracks build state across set calls
Prevents build until required fields are set

best_practices: Use unknown instead of any for safer type narrowing
Prefer inference and helper types to reduce duplication
Enable strict compiler options for stronger guarantees
anti_patterns: Overusing any to bypass type checking
Creating overly complex conditional types without need
Ignoring strict null checks in data models

faq.question: What TypeScript versions are supported?
faq.answer: The concepts are based on modern TypeScript and should work with current stable releases.

faq.question: Are there limits on type complexity?
faq.answer: Very deep conditional or recursive types can slow compilation.

faq.question: Can this integrate with my existing codebase?
faq.answer: Yes, you can adapt the patterns to your interfaces and utility types.

faq.question: Does it access my data or files?
faq.answer: No, it provides guidance only and does not access local data.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot type errors?
faq.answer: Start with strict mode, simplify types, and add small helper types.

faq.question: How does this compare to general TypeScript help?
faq.answer: It focuses on advanced patterns like conditional, mapped, and template literal types.
